Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding an internal flight alternative (IFA) in Nigeria
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim determination
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant lacked credibility due to insufficient corroborative evidence
Evidence_Type: Lack of corroborative evidence supporting persecution claims
Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA – Convention refugee definition
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Availability of Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) in Lagos or Abuja
Application_Factor: Undue hardship from relocation not established
Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of IFA and reasonableness of Board's finding
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Internal flight alternative doctrine under Canadian refugee law
Outcome_of_Review: Application dismissed; no serious question of general importance certified
Cause_of_Refusal: Available IFA and failure to prove risk of persecution throughout country
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to support risk of persecution
Procedural_Fairness: Process followed according to IRB guidelines
Credibility_Issues: Applicant failed to provide credible, consistent, and compelling evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to IFA finding based on alleged persecution risk
Jurisdictional_Focus: Nigeria – Lagos and Abuja as IFAs
Relevant_Law: Canadian immigration and refugee law, including jurisprudence on IFA
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process following negative refugee determination
Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient documentation or witness testimony
